org.typemeta.funcj.codec

Class BaseCodecCore<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.typemeta.funcj.codec.BaseCodecCore<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the encoded type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CodecCore<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonCodecCoreImpl, XmlCodecCoreImpl

    public abstract class BaseCodecCore<E>
extends Object
implements CodecCore<E>
    Base class for classes which implement an encoding into a specific target type.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

    • Field Detail

      • codecRegistry

        protected final ConcurrentMap<String,Codec<?,E>> codecRegistry
        A map from class name to Codec, associating a class with its Codec. Although Codecs can be registered by the caller prior to en/decoding, the primary populator of the registry is this CodecCore implementation. As and when new classes are encountered, they are inspected via Reflection, and a Codec is constructed and registered.

      • typeCtorRegistry

        protected final ConcurrentMap<String,TypeConstructor<?>> typeCtorRegistry
        A map from class name to TypeConstructor, associating a class with its TypeConstructor. Although TypeConstructors can be registered by the caller prior to en/decoding, the primary populator of the registry is this CodecCore implementation. As and when new classes are encountered, they are inspected via Reflection, and a TypeConstructor is constructed and registered.

      • typeProxyRegistry

        protected final Map<String,Class<?>> typeProxyRegistry
        A map from class name to its type proxy, associating a class with its type proxy.

      • getNullSafeCodec

        public <T> Codec<T,E> getNullSafeCodec(Class<T> type)

      • getCodec

        protected <T> Codec<T,E> getCodec(String name,
                                  Functions.F0<Codec<T,E>> codecSupp)
        Lookup a Codec for a name, and, if one doesn't exist, then use the codecSupp to create a new one.

        This is slightly tricky as it needs to be re-entrant in case the type in question is recursive. I.e. codecSupp, when invoked, may call this method again for the same type.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the raw type to be encoded/decoded
        Parameters:
        name - the type name
        codecSupp - a supplier of the Codec value
        Returns:
        the Codec for the specified name
